definition: cangue (wooden collar like stocks used to restrain and punish criminals in China)
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
variant of 連枷|连枷[lian2 jia1]

sentences.english: Don't practice yoga in the mom ing. The best time is at night.
sentences.chinese: 不要在早上练瑜伽，练瑜枷的最佳时间是晚上。

sentences.english: I have seen the freest among you wear their freedom as a yoke and a handcuff.
sentences.chinese: 我曾看见你们之中最自由者，把自由像枷铐似的戴上。

sentences.english: Well-disciplined with daily yoga exercises, and you must have a buff body.
sentences.chinese: 每天定时练瑜枷，你肯定拥有健美的体形。

sentences.english: Then on the day after, Pashhur let Jeremiah loose.
sentences.chinese: 次日，巴施户珥将耶利米开枷释放。

sentences.english: Unauthorised or illegally parked vehicles will be clamped.
sentences.chinese: 未经认可或违章停放的车辆将被锁上铁枷。

definition: a staff/a rod/cane/walking stick/to flog with a stick (old)
traditionally used as phonetic for ga/also pr. [ga1]/also pr. [qie2]
